result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmie L. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
** Pay restitution - to be determined.  May Not have contact with victim.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

supervisions.notes: "PREVIOUS SENTENCE OF 1/21/2016 FOR CT 2  IS VACATED AND DISMISSED."

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously paid).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
** Pay Restitution - to be determined.  May Not have contact with victim.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Granting Postconviction Relief

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Suzanne Lois Hagopian.  The parties have come to agreement and the DE is withdrawing his motion to withdraw the plea.  The conviction is being vacated on ct. 2 and dismissed.   An amended JOC is to be prepaid and sent to the parties.  The DE is currently housed at New Lisbon Correctional.  Clerk D. Smith.

4/25/18 - Motion on Postconviction Relief Hearing

ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hannah Jurss.  The State's witness is on vacation & not available for the hearing.  The DE & his counsel elect to have the hearing conducted all at once opposed to holding 2 separate hearings.  Motion on postconviction relief rescheduled to 6/20/18 @ 2:30.  Writ was prepared in court.  Clerk D. Smith.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Case here for re-sentencing.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

Count 1 - deft sentenced to 6yrs & 3mos WSP; initial confinement of 5yrs followed by 1yr & 3mos of ES.  ES conditions to be the same as previously imposed.  Credit for 370 days.

Count 2 -  deft sentenced to 6yrs & 3mos WSP; initial confinement of 5yrs followed by 1yr & 3mos of ES consecutive to count 1.  ES conditions to be the same as previously imposed. 

Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.

Appeal rights.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Matt Perz.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; victim statement made.  Sentencing arguments.  Deft sentenced to 6yrs WSP on each count consecutive; initial confinement of 5yrs followed by 1yr of ES.  See conditions.  Credit for 101 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
